newsitem.title: USA: Wife says Cosby's affair is no longer an issue.
newsitem.headline: Wife says Cosby's affair is no longer an issue.

text.p: The wife of entertainer Bill Cosby made clear on Tuesday she stood by him, saying the affair he disclosed this week was an old issue that had long been resolved.

Camille Cosby, the star's wife of 33 years, said what was important to her was that authorities arrest the murderer of the couple's 27-year-old son Ennis, gunned down on Jan. 16 as he changed a tire on a Los Angeles freeway.

In his first interview since the killing, Bill Cosby told CBS News anchorman Dan Rather this week that he had had a "rendezvous" with the mother of 22-year-old Autumn Jackson, but he denied being Jackson's father.

Jackson and Jose Medina, 51, were arrested recently on charges they demanded money from Cosby to keep them from selling a story to a tabloid newspaper alleging that Jackson was the entertainer's illegitimate daughter.
Camille Cosby made clear in a statement issued by Cosby's publicist that the affair was no longer an issue between her and her husband.

"All old personal negative issues were resolved by Bill and me years ago. We are a united couple. What occurred 23 years ago is not important to me except for the current issue of extortion," she said.
"What is very important to me is for the authorities to apprehend the person or persons who killed our son," she said, appealing to the public to help find the murderer or murderers.
Jackson was released from prison on Monday night after two people guaranteed her $250,000 bond. Authorities have said the alleged extortion attempt is not related to Ennis Cosby's murder.

A woman who saw part of the attack on Ennis Cosby gave police a description of the killer as a white male wearing a knit cap. The description was used to put together a composite drawing of the suspect but no arrests have been made so far.
